content.description: Trendy furnishings and splashes of neon set the scene at this stylish outdoor bar
Left Bank’s interior feels like it could belong to a spaceship in a 60s sci-fi flick
Popular cocktail bar is guaranteed to be busy
The only outlet of its kind in Al Ain. A Cuban band plays some toe-tapping Spanish-Latin music

Renowned for its good quality live music; Thursday nights pull a mature multi-cultural crowd who enjoy listening to covers by Prince and The Cranberries. DJ Chalkie then takes to the decks to play requests, the odd person has a boogie, but there’s no dancefloor. The pub has TV screens to watch sports matches
Bizarre small bar which is decked out in a car theme. If you look up at the ceiling, there are bits of car bonnets and all sorts. Middle of the road trio sing
Faux Irish pub that has regular DJs; including an excellent DJ on a Friday afternoon. Enjoy the happy hour(s) daily between 12 noon-7pm and 10pm-11pm. Sports screened on Saturday and Sunday nights

Guest DJs play chillout and house music on Thursdays. Regular drink promos to lure the ladies. The restaurant and bar is decorated in a Colonial style. During winter you can chill out on beanbags as you sip their expertly-made cocktails
Stylish bar with slick cocktails and plenty of chill out music
A smoky bar with a pianist. It holds a weekly ladies’ night on Wednesdays where you can have a free glass of bubbly
Restaurant bar with comfy chairs, cocktails and a lounge vibe
Nightclub with a live band playing Latin music and a DJ
Holds quizzes and barbecues
South-of-the-border style bar with well-placed TVs showing sports
Not the best club in town, women should give it a miss
A glam makeover has given what was Embassy a chic new look, a Michelin starred chef and plenty of style
A Roman-themed nightclub/restaurant that features a sunken, amphitheatre dancefloor. Different music every night. Always busy. A place to head when everywhere else has closed
Restaurant and Arabic nightclub that hosts salsa nights
Mexican restaurant that hosts weekly dance nights
Dated wine bar with modern European cuisine
A dark and dingy American-themed bar with a regular rock band and DJ
A typical low-ceilinged English pub. Pleasant enough, serves great pub grub. Daily happy hour from 5pm-7pm. Most people’s favourite pub in Abu Dhabi, partly because there’s outdoor seating
Flamenco chillout music
Popular pub with drinks deals and German theme
Every night is packed with a mixed crowd that love the Filipino band. Expect them to play rock classics
Don’t stop shopping for this eatery – it’s not worth it
Bog-standard Chinese fare at bargain prices

address.street: Rashid Bin Saeed Al Maktoum Street
Rashid Bin Saeed Al Maktoum Street

content.description: Upscale spot for lunchtime dining
One of the big Emirates Palace openings of 2010, claiming to be the city’s only Emirati restaurant
Iftars are open to everyone and they’re as much about socialising as eating, so enjoy
Love the linguine. Shun the sushi behind the Marina Mall
It’s been a long time in development, but London’s Michelin-starred Hakkasan finally has a home in the capital. Jon Wilks meets the head chef
There are those that believe the humble mall restaurant to be not worth anybody’s time. Time Out puts five of them to the test
With 15 main courses to choose from, Al Bathna has big potential for all the family

address.street: King Khalid Bin Abdel Aziz Street
King Khalid Bin Abdel Aziz Street

content.description: Happily low-key Egyptian fare hidden off the beaten track...
A culinary Jack of all trades specialising in Asian favourites...
Average all-day dining venue at Aloft Abu Dhabi...
We check out Kamayan Barrio Fiesta for Asian food off Najda Street...
Chef Lloyd Cremer takes Claire Carutthers on a trip to Spice Island

address.street: Shaikh Rashid Bin Saeed Al Maktoum Street
Shaikh Rashid Bin Saeed Al Maktoum Street

content.description: Inexpensive international grub in Traders Hotel...
Slick dining spot in the Holiday Inn Hotel...
Stylish Japanese sister spot of Wasabi...

content.openingtimes: Open Sun-Wed noon-3pm, 7pm-11pm; Thu & Sat noon-3pm, 7pm-11.30pm
Open Mon 7pm-12.30am; Tue 7pm-1.30pm; Wed 7pm-12.30am; Thu-Fri 7pm-1.30am; Sun 7pm-12.30am

content.description: Sahriye
18 OZ
Hidden spot on the banks of Mina Port...
The spelling isn’t too far off the mark, and neither is the food, but something is amiss at Kwality
Try lunch at this old-stager nestling on the edge of Hamdan Street
Is Abu Dhabi becoming a gourmet capital? We go in search of some of the delicacies to be found on the city streets
The winners of Abu Dhabi's most important dining awards are...
International restaurant with African influence in Souk Qaryat Al Beri
Belgium; we know it for its waffles, Hercules Poirot and its reasonably cheap medical procedures. Sadly, only one of these can be found at Le Pain Quotidien, but we’re not complaining
South Korean food near the bus station
Tasty Indian in Kahlidaya Mall
Arabic dining at Mourouj Hotel Apartments
Revolving restaurant over Marina Mall
We've found a month's worth of cheap places to eat in Abu Dhabi...
All breakfasts, no hotels. Time Out hits the streets in search of the best way to start a day in the capital
Attractive restaurant with sublime food
Excellent Indian food at the Qaryat Al Beri Souk
Plush café with simple bites and gourmet meals
Can you find a three-course meal in the capital made entirely of chocolate?
Vast dining garden with international buffet
Just Falafel is a shoebox-sized rebel in the world of fast food. We find out if it is any good
Quirky Lebanese restaurant in the Souk Al Qaryat Al Beri
Authentic and in expensive Chinese food in Abu Dhabi
Brilliant buns, perfect patties and fantastic fries - Time Out goes in search of the best burgers in Abu Dhabi
Backstreet Japanese food behind the Al Diar Capital Hotel
Bohemian café with a New York vibe
We try this Abu Dhabi Lebanese dining spot for size. Arabic delight or risky business?
We try an evening at Intercontinental Abu Dhabi's latest dining venture
content.openingtimes: Open Sun-Wed noon-1am; Thu noon-3am; Fri 2pm-3am; Sat 5pm-1am

content.description: Unassuming and appealing Indonesian restaurant in Abu Dhabi's Tourist Club area
Lebanese food chain popular throughout the UAE
French light bite café serves up healthy meals and quick snacks
Abu Dhabi off-shoot of one of Dubai's trendiest Japanese restaurants
Thai noodle restaurant with seven branches in the UAE
Popular South African steak restaurant at the Souk Qaryat Al Beri
High-class Persian dining in the Emirates Palace
Award-winning Italian restaurant in the Emirates Palace
Authentic Indian food with entertaining surroundings
Out-of-town Italian restaurant at the Al Raha Beach Resort
Asian restaurant situated in Abu Dhabi's Le Meridien hotel
Romantic Italian restaurant with al fresco seating areas
Shopping mall snack stop serves up a wide variety of foods
Trader Vic’s is like a comfortable old shoe: it has a relaxed, warm and intimate feeling about it
The unprepossessing exterior of Foodlands, plonked on the noisy Airport Road – not to mention its slightly off-putting name – does not invite those in search of an authentic curry to visit
The Tavern is one of those British-style pubs that tries desperately to evoke memories of that local back home, but fools no one
Technically, this is two venues

Lebanese restaurants usually do pretty well in Abu Dhabi, largely due to the fact that, considering the amount of Italian, French, and Thai restaurants in the city, they’re probably the closest thing to traditional food
Style wise, with its brown and cream stripes on the outside walls, there’s nothing like Resto in Abu Dhabi
The nasty whiff of Chris De Burgh being put through the cabaret mangler at Chequers is usually enough to make any punter flee immediately

address.street: Near the corner of Fourth and Fifth Streets
Near the corner of Fourth and Fifth Streets

content.description: The nervous beginner, wandering the streets of our capital for the first time, may be forgiven for thinking he has stumbled onto a real steakhouse when he sees the six-foot high, red neon twinkling lights of the Rainbow Steakhouse
Abu Dhabi’s original Vietnamese eatery maintains its authenticity, with pho, goi and other zingy, spicy national dishes served up in an unpretentious style by Vietnamese owners
The Ninar’s interior decor was obviously given time and care

La Brioche is a café that appears French on first inspection, but it takes more than just printing the menu in French and decking the waitresses out in crisp white blouses, tight black skirts and black tights to be a French café

Technically, of course, The Curry House is Nepalese – it used to be called Kathmandu – but their weren’t enough restaurants from the mountain nation to merit a category of its own, so it’s lumped in with Indian
The atmosphere at Heroes is noisy, littered with screens showing the football and it’s got a token covers band
content.openingtimes: Open Sat-Mon noon-1am; Tue-Wed noon-3am; Thu-Fri noon-4am

content.description: This large, lively restaurant is one of Abu Dhabi’s favourites, and with good reason: it’s rare to have a bad meal here, and the staff are well trained enough to know that the customer is always right, already distinguishing it from most of the city’s other eateries
If you fancy a meal here over the weekend, make sure you book ahead
Sevilla is typical of the Al Raha Beach Hotel: classy and understated
The hotel buffet is far from endangered in Abu Dhabi
It takes nerve to put Vlad the Impaler on a restaurant menu
Cauldron is an unwittingly apt name for this dark spot
Ernest Hemingway clearly wasn’t a man who missed too many meals, but if he had to eat very often in the bar that bears his name, our eponymous hero might have found that his appetite diminished
As you descend into Harvester’s the first thing you notice is the grungy carpet, followed by the army of bouncers arranged by the door
High-class bar with excellent quality food
Ever wondered what it feels like to be a tropical fish? Enter Sayad, with its subterranean ultramarine light, glass walls and bubbling fish tanks, and you’ll soon find out
This popular seafood spot comes with a beautiful, airy terrace that overlooks the Corniche, and makes for a very scenic dining experience on winter evenings
Basic international food with few frills
Lebanese Flower’s fuss-free cuisine has earned it a good reputation among Abu Dhabi residents
Abu Dhabi’s dining scene suffers from an abundance of bland Italian restaurants that serve what could be classic simple dishes with little verve or excitement
This is an unpretentious Italian restaurant serving decent food, where good-quality produce shines through
Italian-inspired alternative to fast food court dining
A word of warning; if you’re thinking of visiting Le Vendome it’s a good idea to make a reservation in advance – the place can get as busy as Paris at the Tour de France finale
In the early evening, Zen is quiet and peaceful
When dining at a restaurant in the opulent Shangri-La

While Abu Dhabi is as strong a place as any when it comes to supplying venues for a wallet-busting blow out, opportunities to make like your average Parisian and get to grips with the less refined side to French food are few and far between
It is difficult to pin down the cultural roots of Café Firenze

The Sheraton Khalidiya’s spacious new haunt – The Third Avenue – has heavy doors, stained glass, brass handles, and huge maroon leather chairs where men in tweed waistcoats and wax jackets drink pints of mild and smoke pipes
Admire the white flesh of the shellfish and catch the glint of freshness in the clear eyes of the hammour, and you’ll have no doubt that the best of the morning’s catch is on offer at Fishmarket
Despite the slightly unflattering next-to-lobby setting, Casa Romana is able to conjure up the occasional moment of magic in its Italian cooking
Elaborate decoration, loyal regulars and authentic Lebanese fare

The views at Case Verde of the verdant championship golf course are amazing, and the menu makes for a pleasant read – nothing too fancy; heart-warming soups, salads, seafood and meat entrees all feature
The decor here screams hotel furnishings (beige and brown – lobby decoration 101), and it overlooks the pool, which thankfully dims into the blackness as the evening unfolds
There are a few things in Abu Dhabi that do not change: the summer weather, the erratic drivers and the Taste of Thailand
Japanese food prepared by entertaining table-side chefs
Mandarin piles it high, doesn’t sell it particularly cheap, and serves it averagely
German restaurant with massive portions
There is much about Russian Waterfalls that is endearing
The lighting, atmosphere and friendly smiles that greet you at City Café are enough to make you warm to it instantly
Caffè Florian is a small, unassuming place, sat next to Paris Gallery

The Captain’s Arms has a relatively dark interior and, if it weren’t for its smattering of tables, comfy sofas and lack of scary men on horses, it would bear a strong resemblance to the watering hole where the Lord of the Rings fellowship met Aragorn
Classy establishment heaves with Abu Dhabi’s well-heeled types
I drove to Souq Qaryat Al Beri for dinner at Left Bank with visions of dining in a classic Parisian salon, replete with velvet sofas and dainty tableware
Funky? Check. Romantic? Check. Bustling? Check. Cosy? Check
Abu Dhabi is crying out for alternative dining experiences, and what’s better than dining onboard a yacht with the Corniche water’s gentle waves and the city’s skyline for company?
The NRG sports bar is reminiscent of an ’80s-style leisure centre: all primary colours, industrial decor and lots of space
As the only pub in town, the Horse & Jockey doesn’t really have any competition, but still manages to perform
The variety of food at Selections buffet is better than at most other restaurants, and that is reflected in the price: a hefty Dhs135

There are plenty of good hotel restaurants in Abu Dhabi, but there are also several average and below average ones that seem to have no reason for existing other than to quietly serve the hotels’ long-term guests night after night
Revolving restaurant with excellent international cuisine
Pricey Asian food with wonderful terrace seating
The Royal Orchid is small, dark, and in need of a serious makeover to drag it from its stuck-in-the-’70s’ style
Soba is a modern, well-lit bar and restaurant
Standard Chinese food and excellent views across the water
Tasty tapas and other Spanish delicacies
The standards of Abu Dhabi’s culinary scene have just been raised a notch
Affordable French restaurants with charm and authenticity
Vienna Plaza serves big, creamy coffees (there are 18 to choose from), which go well with brick-sized slabs of gateaux and a long conversation
Café Supreme, found at the top of Marina Mall, has a good view of the Abu Dhabi Corniche skyline
There are only a handful of restaurants in the capital where food of outstanding quality is consistently served
You go to the Rock Bottom Café with friends to drink beer, eat stodgy food, listen to live music from the house band and watch football on one of the many televisions
Very enjoyable seafood restaurant with al fresco terrace
Charming and inviting Persian restaurant is one of the UAE's finest
This place has become known mainly for the intensely pretty music from a mournful oud player who offers a melancholic background to pretty decent Arabic food
Lively Arabic restaurant with music and dancing
When an Italian meal begins with Arabic flatbread rather than ciabatta, olive oil and balsamic vinegar, you do start to worry
If, as is believed in Epicurean circles, the first bite is taken with the eye, the plush, marble interior of the Beach Rotana Abu Dhabi’s Rosebuds restaurant is ambrosia indeed
Citrus is a buffet restaurant nestled in the entrance of the Millennium Hotel, and it is assuredly average
Talay means ‘ocean’ in Thai, so it comes as no surprise that this restaurant features a big seafood bar, as well as a view of some water
Authentic Japanese food in the Al Diar Mina hotel
The main surprise here is that this place is far from full, because it has the makings of a rather good Chinese restaurant
Excellent French restaurant in the Shangri-La hotel
This is what used to be known as Embassy, and those that chose to visit directly before and after the name change would have seen very little difference
The real draw at Oceans seafood restaurant is the expansive bar area with its very comfortable chairs and sofas and low lighting with candles flickering
Moroccan restaurants, especially good ones, are thin on the ground in Abu Dhabi
Mid-range Italian with aspirations to greatness
Five-star cafe with brunch deals and good cakes
At El Sombrero the meal starts with the obligatory chips and salsa, which are crisp and crunchy, the salsa sharp and piquant

Chi-Chi’s always looks the part: it has a large Saguaro cactus in the middle of the floor, a bar with tequila bottles galore, Mexican music wails through the speakers and all the dishes look real enough
South American concept restaurant serves up feasts
These are the people that gave Abu Dhabi ‘tandushi’ – a kooky combo of sushi and Indian tandoori flavours. It really doesn’t work, but the rest of the menu does
Raj Palace is a gaudily over-the-top spot with a life-sized replica of a Keralan house boat and elephants, but it seems that more effort has been used on the decor than the food
Contemporary twist on authentic Indian cooking
Dragon-boating, hunting expo, Belarusian art and more Abu Dhabi fun
We've found the 29 best dishes to try if you like it spicy...
Stills
Further details soon.
The city’s creatives are emerging from their studios. International collective Fanaan are the first to brave the critics
Last time we reviewed the city’s best shawarmas, you got so passionate about the results you threatened our mothers
Saadiyat Golf Club’s new restaurant needs work on its handicap
You’ve been counting down the hours all week for Friday to arrive, so why waste your day stuck at home
Further details soon.
Further details soon.
An Abu Dhabi summer brings with it myriad difficulties, severe sunburn being the least of your worries. Chase away the seasonal boredom with this handy guide
Iran versus Brazil, adrenaline sports, Oktoberfest and more Abu Dhabi stuff
Time Out selects 10 hot spots where you can watch the F1 in style
Boccaccio
Yacht Club
Cooper’s
With the epic Lord of the Dance show tapping its way into Abu Dhabi, Melati Jay takes a look at the steps it took to get here
Dizzee Rascal, Chopin and more of Abu Dhabi excellence
Choosing a hair salon you like doesn't have to be traumatic
BBQ Al Qasr

Entering The One café (located on the first floor of the popular home accessories store) is the equivalent of walking into a UAE episode of Friends: everyone looks relaxed and happy to be there, enjoying the food and good conversation
Decent confectionery in The Souk at Central Market
Further details soon.
Cooper’s

Basketball, rugby, National Day and more Abu Dhabi fun
Upmarket sports bar with hearty grub
Indie music, fighting fun, souk festival and much more

address.street: Next to Abu Dhabi Mall, north end of Ninth Street
Next to Abu Dhabi Mall, north end of Ninth Street
Past Emirates Palace and Presidential Palace
Past Emirates Palace and Presidential Palace

content.description: BTS certified classes
Give your nightlife a lift at one of these Abu Dhabi hotspots
Camels, jungles, spies, champions and more of the best of Abu Dhabi
Hang on tight and enter the wet and wild world of wakeboarding
Alternative Christmas, barbecues, motor festival and more
From traditional Irish stew to Guinness on tap, we join venues across town in raising a glass to St Patrick
This is capable Indian food, served in pleasant surroundings of dark woods and traditional Indian art
Nihal stands out because compared to its brightly lit neighbours, it looks positively quaint
This is a decent budget restaurant that serves good Keralan food
Nice buffet, shame about the à la carte at the Khalidiya Palace Rayhaan
Further details soon.
Passable Indian grub at reasonable prices on Hamdan Street
Fine dining in a theme park? Only in Abu Dhabi. Does it work?
Impressive Asian restaurant in the Grand Millennium Al Wahda
The coolest outdoor nightspots the capital has to offer
Alternative Christmas, barbecues, motor festival and more
You’ll pay for style rather than substance at this East Asian bar
